titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dewey Owens Papers, circa 1977-2007
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett, 2010

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Dewey Owens Papers

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Music manuscripts, programs, and a small amount of other material relating to Owens' work.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dewey Owens (1925-2006) was a harpist, arranger and composer. He was an instructor at Vassar College for many years. He was predeceased by his partner of 37 years, Lawrence J. Majewski, a professor of art conservation at New York University, in 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Music manuscripts, programs, and a small amount of other material relating to Owens' work.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Librarywithout any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Box list created by Sarah Canino. Last updated July 2018.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Vassar College Music Library, March 2010.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Dewey Owens Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
